questions.q: Which is the most common type of primary headache?
questions.explanation: Tension-type headaches are the most common form of primary headache, affecting up to 78% of the population

questions.q: What is the first-line treatment for newly diagnosed Parkinson's disease in patients under 60?
questions.explanation: Dopamine agonists are typically first-line in younger patients to delay levodopa-related motor complications

questions.q: A primipara is in labor and an episiotomy is to be cut. Compared with a midline episiotomy, an advantage of mediolateral episiotomy is:
A patient sustained a laceration of the perineum during delivery, it involved the muscles of the perineal body but not the anal sphincter. Such a laceration would be classified as:
Which of the following statements about episiotomy is FALSE:
questions.A: Median (midline) episiotomy is generally considered to be less painful than mediolateral episiotomy
questions.B: Mediolateral or lateral episiotomy may be associated with more blood loss than the median one
questions.C: Indications for episiotomy include avoiding an imminent perineal tear, the use of forceps, breech delivery, & the delivery of premature infants
questions.D: The earlier the episiotomy is done during delivery, generally the more beneficial it will be in speeding delivery
questions.E: Episiotomy incisions are repaired anatomically in layers
questions.explanation: Episiotomy is not done during delivery unless necessary

questions.q: The first stage of labor:
questions.D: Ends with full dilation of the cervix
questions.explanation: The first stage of labor ends with the full dilation of the cervix

questions.q: The heart rate of a normal fetus at term:
questions.E: There is no baseline heart rate
questions.explanation: Normal fetal heart rate is 120-160 bpm

questions.q: Repetitive late decelerations most commonly indicate:
questions.explanation: Repetitive late decelerations indicate fetal hypoxia

questions.q: Electronic fetal monitoring:
questions.A: Has high specificity but low sensitivity
questions.B: Has low specificity but high sensitivity

questions.q: What is the uterine blood flow at term:
questions.explanation: Increased uterine blood flow is observed at term

questions.q: The following are major indicators of fetal asphyxia:
questions.A: Old meconium at the time of induction of labor
questions.C: Deep type I deceleration in the second stage of labor

questions.q: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of normal labor:
questions.explanation: Moderate bleeding is not a feature of normal labor

questions.q: During which of the following conditions would the serum prolactin level be greatest:
questions.explanation: Prolactin stimulates the production of milk during breastfeeding

questions.q: Regarding prostaglandins:
questions.A: Maintain the corpus luteum of early pregnancy
questions.B: Have no role in the development of menorrhagia
questions.C: Are involved in the onset of labor
questions.D: Have no role in the development of dysmenorrhea
questions.explanation: Prostaglandins are involved in the onset of labor

questions.q: Early deceleration is:
questions.A: Associated with an unengaged head of the fetus
questions.C: A decrease in the fetal heartbeat that peaks after the peak of uterine contraction
questions.E: Results from increased vagal tone secondary to head compression

questions.q: The bishop score is used to predict:
questions.A: The state of the fetus at the time of delivery
questions.B: The success rate of the induction of labor
questions.C: The fetal condition in the uterus
questions.explanation: The bishop score is used to predict the success rate of the induction of labor

questions.q: The volume of amniotic fluid:
questions.A: Is closely related to the fetal crown-rump length in the 3rd trimester of pregnancy
questions.C: Is reduced in severe rhesus disease
questions.explanation: Ultrasound is used to determine and predict the level of amniotic fluid using tools such as the amniotic fluid index

questions.q: Fetal nutrition is dependent on:
questions.explanation: Fetal nutrition depends on multiple factors such as maternal nutrient stores, maternal diet, placental exchange, and maternal metabolism

questions.q: Cephalopelvic disproportion in the absence of gross pelvic abnormality can be diagnosed by:
questions.B: A maternal stature of less than 158 cm

questions.q: Umbilical cord prolapse is associated with all the following, EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Anencephaly is not associated with umbilical prolapse

questions.q: In a case of labor with meconium-stained amniotic fluid, your next step is:
In patients with a bicornuate uterus when getting pregnant, all these complications can occur EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Polyhydramnios is less likely to occur in these patients due to the anatomy of the uterus

questions.q: In Turner's syndrome:
questions.A: A chromosomal structure of 45 XY is characteristic
questions.explanation: Streak ovaries are one of the features of Turner syndrome with a chromosomal structure of XO, and the patients are phenotypically female

questions.q: Sexual differentiation:
questions.A: Development of male genitalia depends on the presence of functioning testes and responsive end organs
questions.B: Due to the absence of testes, XX fetuses exposed to androgens in utero will NOT be masculinized
questions.C: The development of the female genital requires the presence of the ovary
questions.D: A 45 XO fetus will have normal ovaries
questions.E: The development of the testes does not require the presence of the Y chromosome
questions.explanation: The development of male genitalia depends on the presence of functioning testes and responsive end organs

questions.q: Turner syndrome: Which is true?
questions.B: Has testis in the inguinal area
questions.explanation: Turner syndrome patients present with primary amenorrhea with streak ovaries

questions.q: Androgen insensitivity syndrome: Which is true?
questions.B: Phenotype they are female but with ill-developed breasts
questions.D: They have testes that should be kept to produce hormones

questions.q: The karyotype of patients with Androgen insensitivity syndrome is:
questions.explanation: Androgen insensitivity patients have a normal male karyotype of 46XY

questions.q: In Turner syndrome, the following are usually present EXCEPT:
questions.A: The ovaries are usually well developed
questions.C: The girls are of short stature
questions.E: The condition can be diagnosed by chromosomal analysis
questions.explanation: Turner syndrome patients have streak ovaries

questions.q: Regarding Androgen insensitivity syndrome all true EXCEPT:
questions.B: Scant or no pubic and axillary hair
questions.explanation: The karyotype is 46XY

questions.q: Which is not true about Turner's syndrome:

While evaluating a 30-year-old woman for infertility, you diagnosed a bicornuate uterus. You explain that additional testing is necessary because of the woman's increased risk of congenital anomalies in which system?
